metadata.title: CVE-2018-3693 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and branchprediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attackerwith local user access via a speculative buffer overflow and side-channelanalysis.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35
linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-32.35
linux-image-4.13.0-32-lowlatency - 4.13.0-32.35
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1006.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required

intel-microcode - 3.20180312.0~ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-32.35').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1006.7').
linux-aws package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-azure package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-oem package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.3').
intel-microcode package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20180312.0~ubuntu18.04.1').
firefox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
